titles: By the mayor. To the alderman of the ward of [blank] Whereas His Highness the Prince of Orange, hath been pleased to signifie to me this day, that divers persons (pretending themselves to be citizens of London) in a tumultuous and disorderly manner have lately disturbed the present convention of the Lords and Commons at Westminster ...
author: City of London (England). Lord Mayor.
Chapman, John, Sir, 1633-1689.
publisher: Printed by Samuel Roycroft, Printer to the Honourable City of London,
notes: Other title information from first six lines of text.
"Dated the Third Day of February, 1688/9. Wagstaffe."
Reproductions of originals in Guildhall Library (London, England) (reel 1745), and British Library (reel 1928).
keywords: Offenses against public safety --  England --  London.
